response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("age", "medium", "The individual is young, which can be a risk factor for recidivism."),
    ("arrest history", "high", "Having been arrested once and convicted suggests a higher likelihood of future offenses."),
    ("body mass index (BMI)", "low", "His BMI falls within the overweight range but not into obesity, which is generally considered a lower risk factor."),
    ("marital status", "medium", "Not being married may increase his risk for recidivism as individuals with stable relationships tend to have lower recidivism rates."),
    ("residential status", "low", "Living with others may provide social support and reduce the likelihood of reoffending."),
    ("education level", "medium", "Having a GED suggests a lower educational attainment, which can be associated with higher recidivism."),
    ("employment history", "medium", "Holding one job during the year indicates some stability but not enough to significantly mitigate risk."),
    ("drug use", "high", "Past drug use is a significant risk factor for recidivism as it may indicate poor impulse control and a higher likelihood of criminal behavior."),
    ("mental health", "low", "Not feeling depressed over the past month suggests good mental health, which can be protective against recidivism."),
    ("family structure", "medium", "Living with both biological parents at a young age in an urban area may have mixed implications for risk."),
    ("religiosity", "low", "Believing that God has something to do with his personal life suggests a potential source of support and stability.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs between 225 and 249 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
